sentence: Wall Street retreated back into negative territory late Wednesday after the minutes of the September Federal Open Market Committee meeting revealed a majority of Fed members are ready to hike US rates above neutral.
Led by losses in energy, industrial and tech stocks, the Dow was modestly lower, followed by fractional losses for the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite Index.

Weighed down by selling pressure in European equities and soft housing market data, stocks opened lower as simmering geopolitical pressures between the US and Saudi Arabia as well as rekindled US/China trade tensions threatened Tuesday's outsized gains.
Economic data released this morning underscored the slowing momentum in the housing market.
Housing starts dropped 5.3% in September to a seasonally-adjusted annual rate (SAAR) of 1.201 million versus expectations for a decline to 1.216 million.
Housing permits, a barometer of forward looking construction, were down 0.6% to a SAAR of 1.241 million vs 1.272 million estimates.
The data not only drove stocks in the housing sector lower, but the share price of Home Depot ( HD ) and Lowe's ( LOW ).
Among housing stocks, Pulte ( PHM ), Lennar ( LEN ), KB Home ( KBH ) and Beazer Homes (BZH) closed down for the day.
Pot stocks were also in focus after Canada legalized marijuana.
The "sell the fact" reaction across the sector drove shares of Tilray (TLRY) and Canopy Growth (CGC) sharply lower.
The September FOMC minutes showed a unanimous board in favor of more rate hikes given the expectation for inflation to accelerate, the job market to tighten further and the economy to expand.
The reaction compromised modest gains and drove Treasury yields sharply higher with the 10-year note with a 3.20% yield.

FTSE 100 was down 4.80 points (-0.07%) to 7.054.60

Shanghai China Composite Index was up 15.29 points (+0.60%) to 2,561.61

(+) VTVT (+28.42%) To detail late-stage trial results of Azeliragon in Alzheimer's disease

(+) OGEN (+9.65%) Gets clearance to enroll Belgian patients in trial of AG013 in oral mucositis

(-) BLNK (-31.18%) Joins with Google to assist drivers in locating charging stations
